intro: Veronica trichocarpa, commonly known as the slender speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Veronica trichocarpa is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats, and it thrives in well-drained soils.
